description: The primary abstraction of the policy is the objectClass element.An objectClass describes a concept derived from either a builtin zenta element, or another objectClass: the ancestor of the objectClass.We can define the objectClass of an zenta element in one of the following ways:- add a property where the name is "objectClass" and the value is the name of the objectclass- add a property where the name is in the form &lt
name: class&gt
column11: is the name of the objectclass, and &lt
column13: is the name of one of the properties of the objectclass. The value vill be the value of the objectClass property.- create a Group in a view, with the property named "associatedObjectClass". The value of the property should be the name of the objectClass. All the elements within the group (including the nested ones) will belong to the objectClassThe policy related to the objectclass will help to check the model for structure and content, and also makes creating reports and generating configurations easier.One of the examples of this is that the policy for this model can be generated from this model, and the generated policy can be used to check that this model is indeed conforms to the policy which is generated from it :)

description: The attribute is used to describe a attribute of an objectClass.You can define a attribute value either by giving the value to a property named &lt
name: b&gt
column13: to an object, or by using a model structure defined by the defaults of the given attribute.

description: The default is used to describe how a property will get its default value if we have not given anything.It is useful to- describe and enforce structural relationships within the model- give default value to a propertyThis attribute should be entered as a property.
name: default

description: An objectclass predefined by Zenta.This does not show up in the policy file explicitly. Used to have a starting point to generate/document the objectClass hierarchy.
name: ZentamateObjectClass

description: This is an abstract class, so we don't need to define the name and description property for all objectClasses.
name: abstractNamed

description: A collection of applications/systems that belong together eg. Salary payment.
name: ApplicationCollection

description: A server with an operating system, running on a physical or virtual hardware.
name: Server

description: A governance process step.It is used to describe the related actors by the documentcontrol style.
name: GovernanceStep

description: A person belonging to an organisation
name: OrganisationalPerson
